image.altText: LawConnect and Andoo Comanche racing to the finish line.

props.synopsis: LawConnect sensationally overtakes Andoo Comanche with seconds to spare to snatch line honours in the 2023 Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

title.children: LawConnect 'outsails' Andoo Comanche in nail-biting Sydney to Hobart finish

image.altText: Simi Gill sits on a chair near a clothesline with grape vines in the background near Barmera, South Australia, November 2023.

props.synopsis: Its water creates a home, a playground and a food bowl – but those who live on the Murray believe it can be managed better. We take a look at life on Australia's longest river.

title.children: The Murray is a lifeline for Australia's food and water supply, but the climate's changing

image.altText: A wide shot of Len La Tous's devastated home from the Christmas Day storms.

props.synopsis: More intense storms are forecast to hit south-east Queensland on the weekend, just days after the region endured several deadly weather systems, including a "mini cyclone".

title.children: More storms, heatwaves inbound for south-east Queensland after region cops destructive tornado

image.altText: Signage on a glass fronted building reads 'The New York Times' in a calligraphic font

props.synopsis: The New York Times is taking legal action against Microsoft and OpenAI over their artificial intelligence-powered programs. This is what it's alleges the chatbots are up to.

title.children: 'The cost to society will be enormous': Here's why the New York Times has just sued two tech titans

image.altText: A man in glasses puts his hand around the shoulders of another man as both of them laugh and look away from the camera

props.synopsis: Ibrahim Bazzi travelled to Lebanon to bring his wife back to Sydney to start a new life, while his brother Ali moved there to get married a few years ago.

title.children: Australian man and his brother killed in Lebanon after building hit by Israeli air strike, family says

image.altText: Umpires stand under umbrellas

props.synopsis: Pakistan fought valiantly on day two, but a devastating final session gave Australia the initiative heading into day three. Follow all the updates from the MCG in our live blog.

title.children: Rainy start delays Australia's push for quick wickets on day three at the MCG

image.altText: Avocado toast and a coffee on a table.

props.synopsis: Thirty years ago Bill Granger put a dish on his Darlinghurst cafe menu. It came to represent so much more to a generation locked out of the housing market, writes Leigh Tonkin.

title.children: Bill Granger brought avocado toast to cafes — and now it means something else entirely

image.altText: A family is checked by an official near a truck.

props.synopsis: The Rafah crossing is one of the few bridges between Gaza and the world outside. For Sahar Ramy and her family, it was their only means of escape to Egypt.

title.children: Sahar was warned of danger at the Rafah crossing. Desperate to escape, she took a chance

image.altText: A man and a woman sitting on a front deck with a white cat in front of them

props.synopsis: From living out of an office to a houseboat in a marina, some people are turning to "non-traditional" methods of housing in order to put a roof over their heads.

title.children: Why rent a house when a hotel room is cheaper?

image.altText: Sign telling people to ignore GPS instructions in Quairading.

props.synopsis: A shire in Western Australia's Wheatbelt has erected signs warning travellers to ignore GPS directions as they are sending drivers to unsealed, often treacherous roads.

title.children: 'Your GPS is wrong': Council acts after Google maps repeatedly sends drivers onto unsafe roads

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The local share market is likely to rise in morning trade, which would drive the ASX to a fresh 20-month high, while the Australian dollar is trading at its highest level in five months on expectations of steep US interest rate cuts next year. Follow live.

title.children: ASX likely to extend 20-month high, as markets bet on interest rate cuts in 2024

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Oil prices drop as shipping giants return to Red Sea, despite risk of Houthi attacks
ASX to open higher on second-last trading session of 2023

image.altText: Trump grimaces as he speaks at a rally outside in the hot sun, with sweat visible on his face.

props.synopsis: The Michigan Supreme Court has rejected an attempt to remove former president Donald Trump from the 2024 ballot based on the US Constitution's "insurrectionist ban".

title.children: Michigan Supreme Court rejects attempt to remove Trump from 2024 ballot

image.altText: A view of a bronze statue of Shakira. She's in a sarong and bikini top. Her hair is long and she's in the middle of dancing.

props.synopsis: Latin superstar Shakira has been immortalised in her Colombian hometown of Barranquilla where a giant bronze statue of the multiple Grammy-winning singer is now on display.

title.children: Shakira's Colombian hometown unveils a giant statue in her honour

image.altText: Australian artists Tones And I sings into a microphone in a studio for Triple J's Like a Version

props.synopsis: A hullabaloo is brewing between some of Australia's biggest names in music and the radio stations that play their songs, over a push for the stations to pay artists more when their songs are played.

title.children: Why are recording artists calling for more pay for radio play?

image.altText: A boy in front of trees

props.synopsis: Since 1996, the Japanese video game franchise has taken the world by storm, with Australia now playing host to many of the very best players in the world.

title.children: Meet the Australians having an outsized impact on the competitive world of Pokémon

image.altText: Richard Bennett photographing the Sydney to Hobart race.

props.synopsis: In 1998, Richard Bennet was on his usual gig photographing the Sydney to Hobart yachts when the aircraft he was using was seconded to join the race to rescue sailors. It's just one of the dramas he's documented in his 50 years behind the camera.

title.children: Richard Bennett reflects on 50 years photographing the calm and chaos of the Sydney to Hobart

image.altText: Woman in beige coat holds pile of bue papers

props.synopsis: Former TV journalist Yekaterina Duntsova has lost her appeal to run against President Vladimir Putin in Russia's presidential election next March, after she was banned due to errors in the paperwork.

title.children: Pro-peace Putin challenger loses appeal after being banned from running in Russia's 2024 election

image.altText: Three AFL players in red, white and blue raucously sing, with arms around each other

props.synopsis: Chinese-Australians have had close links to Aussie rules football ever since the sport was invented. So why don't more of us know about it?

title.children: Is this 'the great hidden chapter' behind one of Australia's biggest sports?

image.altText: A group of fabric dolls laying on a table.

props.synopsis: A doll-making class in Perth's northern suburbs is helping refugee women make sense of the trauma they have experienced while raising awareness of mental health.

title.children: Women who fled conflict for a new life are turning to dolls to help deal with the past

image.altText: Taika Waititi stands in crisp white clothes and sunnies, in front of a soccer net on a field, ball under one arm

props.synopsis: Next Goal Wins is about a disastrous soccer team known for a 31-nil loss to Australia  – but the heart of the movie is the character based on Jaiyah Saelua, the first openly trans athlete to compete in a FIFA World Cup qualifier.

title.children: Taika Waititi's Next Goal Wins is more than an underdog sports film — it's about being happy

image.altText: Taylor Swift performs during "The Eras Tour".

props.synopsis: The 23-year-old fan had collapsed while attending the first of six shows that Swift performed in Brazil as part of The Eras Tour.

title.children: Taylor Swift fan died of heat exhaustion during Rio concert, report says

image.altText: Composite image of Lisa Marie Presley, Burt Bacharach and Tina Turner.

props.synopsis: From punk rockers to crooners, best friends to magicians, the world lost some well known faces and creative geniuses this year.

title.children: Looking back at the celebrities who died this year

image.altText: A photo of a woman wearing grey racerback top stretching, shot from behind

props.synopsis: There are no quick fixes or short cuts to living longer and healthier lives, but the science is clear on the key principles. Here are five things you can do to extend your lifespan and improve your health, writes Hassan Vally.

title.children: You can't reverse the ageing process but these five things can help you live longer

image.altText: Two girls smile.

props.synopsis: Adelaide twins Charlotte and Cindy Chen may only be 10 years old, but they're both tipped to one day become chess grand masters.

title.children: 'Chess queens' in bid for glory at national championships

image.altText: Tom and CJ In 2022 with the National Wheelchair Basketball League championship trophy.

props.synopsis: Tom and CJ have been friends for decades. Now the two mates, who had to leave home for their sporting opportunities, have reunited to bring those opportunities home.

title.children: 'You cannot be what you cannot see': How two Darwin friends helped form the Darwin Salties

image.altText: A young boy wearing a white shirt and black cap closely ties a knot out of leafy material under a tree.

props.synopsis: A Queensland adventurer is on a mission to get children off their screens and into the bush — and a child psychologist says the health benefits are huge.

title.children: Digital detox retreat getting kids off phones while teaching 'lost' outdoor survival skills

image.altText: Two re-enactors in medieval armour fighting.

props.synopsis: Heraldry was once used to tell armies apart on the battlefield. Today's modern re-enactments of medieval battles follow a rich European tradition — with a twist.

title.children: Combat, testicles and history — the meaning behind Australia's modern-day medieval heraldry
